metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17847 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Enigmail before 1.9.9. Signature spoofing ispossible because the UI does not properly distinguish between an attachmentsignature, and a signature that applies to the entire containing message,aka TBE-01-021. This is demonstrated by an e-mail message with anattachment that is a signed e-mail message in message/rfc822 format.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17847` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

enigmail - 2:1.9.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: enigmail package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.9.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
